TestItem.Comment: Drag your answer choices to the spaces where they belong.

tpObject_list.tpObject: 43,574,454,0,Due to the Coriolis force, icebergs move at a right angle to the prevailing wind.
534,571,444,0,Because of the Earth's rotation, objects moving away from or toward the equator travel at different speeds in relation to fixed points at different latitudes.
44,649,454,0,In order to reach the correct destination, an airplane pilot must adjust direction to compensate for the Coriolis force.
534,650,425,0,Because of deflection and differences in linear speed, ocean currents move at an angle to the wind.
43,728,466,0,Water at successively lower levels is deflected at an angle to the layer immediately above it, and this creates a spiral.
534,729,434,0,Due to upwelling of water, marine life is rich in areas where Ekman spirals operate.
